duties_responsibilities.duty: Extract clinical information and assign appropriate procedural terminology and medical codes to patient records.
Confirm appropriate diagnosis related group (DRG) assignments and analyze, enter, and manipulate databases.
Provide expert coding auditing, coding, and documentation improvement education.
Utilize encoders and various coding resources, conduct peer reviews, and ensure compliance with coding guidelines.
Maintain strict patient and physician confidentiality and follow all federal, state, and hospital guidelines for release of information.
Maintain current working knowledge of ICD-10 coding principles, government regulations, and protocols.

education_certification.credential: RHIA, RHIT, CCS Certification(s) and Bachelor's degree in related field (Master's preferred)
